004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
012import java.util.Objects;
013
014/** Represents a 2D pose containing translational and rotational elements. */
015@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
016@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
017public class Pose2d implements Interpolatable<Pose2d> {
018  private final Translation2d m_translation;
019  private final Rotation2d m_rotation;
020
021  /** Constructs a pose at the origin facing toward the positive X axis. */
022  public Pose2d() {
023    m_translation = new Translation2d();
024    m_rotation = new Rotation2d();
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Constructs a pose with the specified translation and rotation.
029   *
030   * @param translation The translational component of the pose.
031   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
032   */
033  @JsonCreator
034  public Pose2d(
035      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "translation") Translation2d translation,
036      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "rotation") Rotation2d rotation) {
037    m_translation = translation;
038    m_rotation = rotation;
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Constructs a pose with x and y translations instead of a separate Translation2d.
043   *
044   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the pose.
045   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the pose.
046   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
047   */
048  public Pose2d(double x, double y, Rotation2d rotation) {
049    m_translation = new Translation2d(x, y);
050    m_rotation = rotation;
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Transforms the pose by the given transformation and returns the new transformed pose.
055   *
056   * <pre>
057   * [x_new]    [cos, -sin, 0][transform.x]
058   * [y_new] += [sin,  cos, 0][transform.y]
059   * [t_new]    [  0,    0, 1][transform.t]
060   * </pre>
061   *
062   * @param other The transform to transform the pose by.
063   * @return The transformed pose.
064   */
065  public Pose2d plus(Transform2d other) {
066    return transformBy(other);
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Returns the Transform2d that maps the one pose to another.
071   *
072   * @param other The initial pose of the transformation.
073   * @return The transform that maps the other pose to the current pose.
074   */
075  public Transform2d minus(Pose2d other) {
076    final var pose = this.relativeTo(other);
077    return new Transform2d(pose.getTranslation(), pose.getRotation());
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Returns the translation component of the transformation.
082   *
083   * @return The translational component of the pose.
084   */
085  @JsonProperty
086  public Translation2d getTranslation() {
087    return m_translation;
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Returns the X component of the pose's translation.
092   *
093   * @return The x component of the pose's translation.
094   */
095  public double getX() {
096    return m_translation.getX();
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Returns the Y component of the pose's translation.
101   *
102   * @return The y component of the pose's translation.
103   */
104  public double getY() {
105    return m_translation.getY();
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Returns the rotational component of the transformation.
110   *
111   * @return The rotational component of the pose.
112   */
113  @JsonProperty
114  public Rotation2d getRotation() {
115    return m_rotation;
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * Multiplies the current pose by a scalar.
120   *
121   * @param scalar The scalar.
122   * @return The new scaled Pose2d.
123   */
124  public Pose2d times(double scalar) {
125    return new Pose2d(m_translation.times(scalar), m_rotation.times(scalar));
126  }
127
128  /**
129   * Divides the current pose by a scalar.
130   *
131   * @param scalar The scalar.
132   * @return The new scaled Pose2d.
133   */
134  public Pose2d div(double scalar) {
135    return times(1.0 / scalar);
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Transforms the pose by the given transformation and returns the new pose. See + operator for
140   * the matrix multiplication performed.
141   *
142   * @param other The transform to transform the pose by.
143   * @return The transformed pose.
144   */
145  public Pose2d transformBy(Transform2d other) {
146    return new Pose2d(
147        m_translation.plus(other.getTranslation().rotateBy(m_rotation)),
148        other.getRotation().plus(m_rotation));
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Returns the current pose relative to the given pose.
153   *
154   * <p>This function can often be used for trajectory tracking or pose stabilization algorithms to
155   * get the error between the reference and the current pose.
156   *
157   * @param other The pose that is the origin of the new coordinate frame that the current pose will
158   *     be converted into.
159   * @return The current pose relative to the new origin pose.
160   */
161  public Pose2d relativeTo(Pose2d other) {
162    var transform = new Transform2d(other, this);
163    return new Pose2d(transform.getTranslation(), transform.getRotation());
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Obtain a new Pose2d from a (constant curvature) velocity.
168   *
169   * <p>See <a href="https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf">Controls
170   * Engineering in the FIRST Robotics Competition</a> section 10.2 "Pose exponential" for a
171   * derivation.
172   *
173   * <p>The twist is a change in pose in the robot's coordinate frame since the previous pose
174   * update. When the user runs exp() on the previous known field-relative pose with the argument
175   * being the twist, the user will receive the new field-relative pose.
176   *
177   * <p>"Exp" represents the pose exponential, which is solving a differential equation moving the
178   * pose forward in time.
179   *
180   * @param twist The change in pose in the robot's coordinate frame since the previous pose update.
181   *     For example, if a non-holonomic robot moves forward 0.01 meters and changes angle by 0.5
182   *     degrees since the previous pose update, the twist would be Twist2d(0.01, 0.0,
183   *     Units.degreesToRadians(0.5)).
184   * @return The new pose of the robot.
185   */
186  public Pose2d exp(Twist2d twist) {
187    double dx = twist.dx;
188    double dy = twist.dy;
189    double dtheta = twist.dtheta;
190
191    double sinTheta = Math.sin(dtheta);
192    double cosTheta = Math.cos(dtheta);
193
194    double s;
195    double c;
196    if (Math.abs(dtheta) < 1E-9) {
197      s = 1.0 - 1.0 / 6.0 * dtheta * dtheta;
198      c = 0.5 * dtheta;
199    } else {
200      s = sinTheta / dtheta;
201      c = (1 - cosTheta) / dtheta;
202    }
203    var transform =
204        new Transform2d(
205            new Translation2d(dx * s - dy * c, dx * c + dy * s),
206            new Rotation2d(cosTheta, sinTheta));
207
208    return this.plus(transform);
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Returns a Twist2d that maps this pose to the end pose. If c is the output of a.Log(b), then
213   * a.Exp(c) would yield b.
214   *
215   * @param end The end pose for the transformation.
216   * @return The twist that maps this to end.
217   */
218  public Twist2d log(Pose2d end) {
219    final var transform = end.relativeTo(this);
220    final var dtheta = transform.getRotation().getRadians();
221    final var halfDtheta = dtheta / 2.0;
222
223    final var cosMinusOne = transform.getRotation().getCos() - 1;
224
225    double halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta;
226    if (Math.abs(cosMinusOne) < 1E-9) {
227      halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta = 1.0 - 1.0 / 12.0 * dtheta * dtheta;
228    } else {
229      halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta = -(halfDtheta * transform.getRotation().getSin()) / cosMinusOne;
230    }
231
232    Translation2d translationPart =
233        transform
234            .getTranslation()
235            .rotateBy(new Rotation2d(halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta, -halfDtheta))
236            .times(Math.hypot(halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta, halfDtheta));
237
238    return new Twist2d(translationPart.getX(), translationPart.getY(), dtheta);
239  }
240
241  @Override
242  public String toString() {
243    return String.format("Pose2d(%s, %s)", m_translation, m_rotation);
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Checks equality between this Pose2d and another object.
248   *
249   * @param obj The other object.
250   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
251   */
252  @Override
253  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
254    if (obj instanceof Pose2d) {
255      return ((Pose2d) obj).m_translation.equals(m_translation)
256          && ((Pose2d) obj).m_rotation.equals(m_rotation);
257    }
258    return false;
259  }
260
261  @Override
262  public int hashCode() {
263    return Objects.hash(m_translation, m_rotation);
264  }
265
266  @Override
267  public Pose2d interpolate(Pose2d endValue, double t) {
268    if (t < 0) {
269      return this;
270    } else if (t >= 1) {
271      return endValue;
272    } else {
273      var twist = this.log(endValue);
274      var scaledTwist = new Twist2d(twist.dx * t, twist.dy * t, twist.dtheta * t);
275      return this.exp(scaledTwist);
276    }
277  }
278}
